page.title: 13Tourism(3)-Broughton/Holt
page.content: CHURCHES St Mary's Broughton Gifford Where St Mary's now stands a church was erected in 13th.c., considerably altered in 15th.c. and restored in 1850. Features of interest include a piscina in the chancel and the chantry chapel. The east wall is hollowed to form a recessed curve over the altar. To the north of this is a squint and the remains of stairs leading to the roof loft, the north arcade is 13th.c. The porch had a wooden ceiling originally forming a 2nd storey, the stone stairs to this can be seen in the west wall, the east wall has glazed slits once used by lepers. Inside the south door is a curious brass in memory of Robert Longe. There have been 58 rectors at the church since the first in 1308.
